cards.name: Tendrils of Corruption
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
cards.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Mutilate
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.
cards.flavor: Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.

rulings.text: The effect is based on the number of Swamps you control when Mutilate resolves. Only creatures on the battlefield at that time will be affected. The effect won't change later in the turn, even if the number of Swamps you control changes.

cards.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn't overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can't be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature's colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave's effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature's types or subtypes.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
cards.text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Enslave
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

rulings.text: The owner of a card is the player who started the game with that card in their deck. If the card didn't start the game in a deck, its owner is the player who brought the card into the game, via Living Wish or a similar effect.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Ambush Commander
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Allosaurus Rider
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.

rulings.text: Paying the alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast the spell. A creature spell you cast this way, for example, can still only be cast during your main phase while the stack is empty.
You may pay the alternative cost rather than the card's mana cost. Any additional costs are paid as normal.
If you don't have two cards of the right color in your hand, you can't choose to cast the spell using the alternative cost.
You can't exile a card from your hand to pay for itself. At the time you would pay costs, that card is on the stack, not in your hand.

cards.originalText:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay Allosaurus Rider's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Elvish Eulogist
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."

rulings.text: By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Elvish Harbinger
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
When Elvish Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
When Elvish Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Elvish Warrior
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

cards.name: Gempalm Strider
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G}{G} ({2}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Strider, Elf creatures get +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}{G}{G} ({2}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Strider, Elf creatures get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.text:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Channel your vitality through me."
cards.originalText:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves on the battlefield.

cards.text:

cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.

One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

rulings.text: Lys Alana Huntmaster's ability will resolve before the Elf spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.

Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
When Sylvan Messenger enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Elf cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Timberwatch Elf
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Even through the Mirari's voice, the elves still hear the call of their kinship.

rulings.text: The number of Elves on the battlefield is counted only as Timberwatch Elf's ability resolves. If Timberwatch Elf is still on the battlefield, it'll count itself.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.

cards.name: Voice of the Woods
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Create a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample.
cards.flavor: The ritual of making draws upon the elves' memories and pasts. And elves have long memories and ancient pasts.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Put a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample onto the battlefield.

cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Gempalm Incinerator
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

rulings.text: The target of the ability can't be a creature with Protection from Creatures, with Protection from Goblins, or with Protection from Red.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

cards.name: Goblin Cohort
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
cards.flavor: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.
cards.originalText: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: There's always room for one more.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

Haste

cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

rulings.text: Goblin Warchief's effect reduces only generic mana in the cost of Goblin spells you cast. For example, it doesn't reduce the cost of Skirk Prospector below {R}.

cards.originalText:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.

cards.name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"

rulings.text: If you don't actually sacrifice the Goblin (because it was removed from the battlefield before the ability resolved, for example), no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "I order you to volunteer."
cards.originalText: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Skirk Fire Marshal
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.name: Tar Pitcher

cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to any target.

"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Twilight Shepherd
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
When Twilight Shepherd enters the battlefield, return to your hand all cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

rulings.text: If a creature with persist stops being a creature, persist will still work.

The persist ability triggers when the permanent is put into a graveyard. Its last known information (that is, how the creature last existed on the battlefield) is used to determine whether it had a -1/-1 counter on it.

If a permanent has multiple instances of persist, they'll each trigger separately, but the redundant instances will have no effect. If one instance returns the card to the battlefield, the next to resolve will do nothing.
If a token with no -1/-1 counters on it has persist, the ability will trigger when the token is put into the graveyard. However, the token will cease to exist and can't return to the battlefield.
When a permanent with persist returns to the battlefield, it's a new object with no memory of or connection to its previous existence.

If multiple creatures with persist are put into the graveyard at the same time (due to combat damage or a spell that destroys all creatures, for example), the active player (the player whose turn it is) puts all of their persist triggers on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order does the same. The last trigger put on the stack is the first one that resolves. That means that in a two-player game, the nonactive player's persist creatures will return to the battlefield first, then the active player's persist creatures do the same. The creatures return to the battlefield one at a time.

If a creature with persist that has +1/+1 counters on it receives enough -1/-1 counters to cause it to be destroyed by lethal damage or put into its owner's graveyard for having 0 or less toughness, persist won't trigger and the card won't return to the battlefield. That's because persist checks the creature's existence just before it leaves the battlefield, and it still has all those counters on it at that point.

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
When Twilight Shepherd enters the battlefield, return to your hand all cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Otherworldly Journey
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
cards.text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends."
—Journal found in Numai

rulings.text: The creature comes back onto the battlefield as a new creature, with one +1/+1 counter on it (plus any other counters that it would normally enter the battlefield with).
Any Aura attached to the creature is put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action. Equipment attached to the creature become unattached but remain on the battlefield.
If Otherworldly Journey is cast during an end step, the creature won't return until the beginning of the next end step.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Angelic Benediction
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Even in single combat, I am never alone."
—Rafiq of the Many

rulings.text: If you declare exactly one creature as an attacker, each exalted ability on each permanent you control (including, perhaps, the attacking creature itself) will trigger. The bonuses are given to the attacking creature, not to the permanent with exalted. Ultimately, the attacking creature will wind up with +1/+1 for each of your exalted abilities.
If you attack with multiple creatures, but then all but one are removed from combat, your exalted abilities won't trigger.

Some effects put creatures onto the battlefield attacking. Since those creatures were never declared as attackers, they're ignored by exalted abilities. They won't cause exalted abilities to trigger. If any exalted abilities have already triggered (because exactly one creature was declared as an attacker), those abilities will resolve as normal even though there may now be multiple attackers.
Exalted abilities will resolve before blockers are declared.

Exalted bonuses last until end of turn. If an effect creates an additional combat phase during your turn, a creature that attacked alone during the first combat phase will still have its exalted bonuses in that new phase. If a creature attacks alone during the second combat phase, all your exalted abilities will trigger again.

In a Two-Headed Giant game, a creature "attacks alone" if it's the only creature declared as an attacker by your entire team. If you control that attacking creature, your exalted abilities will trigger but your teammate's exalted abilities won't.
The creature you target with the last ability will become tapped before blockers are declared.

cards.originalText:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, you may tap target creature.

cards.name: Faith's Fetters
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
When Faith's Fetters enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
Enchanted permanent can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

rulings.text: Faith's Fetters doesn't stop static abilities, triggered abilities, or mana abilities from working. A mana ability is an ability that produces mana, not an ability that costs mana.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant permanent
When Faith's Fetters enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
Enchanted permanent's activated abilities can't be activated unless they're mana abilities. If enchanted permanent is a creature, it can't attack or block.

cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a white spell.

If a player casts a white spell, Angel's Feather's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Angel's Feather's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
